description: Redevelopment of existing bungalows to form a two storey residential building with basement to contain nine self-contained flats with associated car parking, cycle parking and forecourt landscaping
decision_conditions: The development to which this permission relates shall be begun not later than the expiration of 3 years from the date of this permission.
Reason: To comply with Section 91 of the Town & Country Planning Act 1990.

| The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawing title numbers:  0048-000 P4 (location plan); 0048-001 P4 (existing site plan); 0048-100 P6 (proposed basement and ground GA), 0048-101 P6 (proposed first and second floor GA); 0048-203 P5 (proposed section C-C); 0048-204 P4 (proposed section C-C); 0048-205 P5 (proposed section D-D); 0048-201 P6 (existing and proposed rear elevation); 0048 200 P6 (existing and proposed front elevations); 0048-002 P6 (proposed site plan); View 01 (towards shared entrance), View 02 (towards side view) & View 03 (view to rear elevation)

Reason: For the avoidance of doubt, and in the interests of proper planning. | Prior to commencement of the development hereby approved, further details of all external materials shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. Details required include the use of a multi-brick, the RAL colour of the aluminium fenestration and balconies.

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with policies 1.1 & 1.2 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7.4 & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), London Plan(2021) policies D3 and D4 and the National Planning Policy Framework (2019). | Notwithstanding the plans hereby approved, further details for privacy screening to a height of 1.8m on the flanks of the rear balconies shall be submitted to and approved in writing prior to occupation of the development.

Reason: To ensure the proposed development does not affect the amenity of neighbours and the privacy of future occupants in accordance with policies 7.4 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policy D6 of the London Plan (2021) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2019). | The proposed rooflights hereby approved shall not project more than 150mm from the roof plane and retained as such for the lifetime of the development.

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, and to safeguard the character and appearance of the area in accordance with policies D3 and D4 of the London Plan (2021) and policies 7.4 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013). | Notwithstanding the provisions of Schedule 2 Part 3 Class L of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) Order 2015 (or any order revoking and re-enacting that Order), at no time shall the units be converted from C3 residential to a C4 small HMO without express planning permission having first been granted by the Local Planning Authority.

Reason: To prevent the overdevelopment of the site and to safeguard the living conditions of adjoining properties and visual appearance of the building, in accordance with policies 7.4 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policy D3 and D4 of the London Plan (2021) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2019). | Prior to occupation of the development, an enhanced sound insulation value DnT,w [and L'nT,w] of at least 5dB above the maximum Building Regulations value, for the floor/ceiling /wall structures separating different types of rooms/ uses in adjoining dwellings, namely bedroom adjacent to staircase, living/dining room and kitchen above/below bedroom of separate dwellings shall be implemented and thereafter be permanently retained.

Reason: To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of the development site is not adversely affected by noise, in accordance with policy D6 of the London Plan (2021), policies 1.1(j) & 1.2(f) of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012) and with policies 4.1, 5.5 and 4.11 policy 3.5 of the Ealing's Development Management Plan Document. | Prior to first occupation of the scheme hereby approved further details for the planting plan and schedule for biodiverse landscaping to the front and rear of the scheme, including permeable hard surfaces, drainage and details of boundary treatments and means of enclosure (including fences, gates, trees, planted screening) shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. Any soft landscaping, including trees which within 5 years of planting, die, are removed or become seriously damaged or diseased shall be replaced within the next planting season.

Reason:  To ensure a satisfactory standard of appearance and setting for the development and to ensure that the proposed development enhances the visual amenity of the locality, in the interests of the amenities of the occupants of the development  in accordance with policies 5.10, 7.4 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies D3, D4 and D6 of the London Plan (2021), the London Environment strategy (2018) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2019). | Notwithstanding the reports submitted with this planning application, prior to the commencement of development, a Construction Management Plan shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The plan shall include the following:
o	Details of construction hours;

o	Noise/Vibration mitigation measures. Information submitted should directly cross-reference with the BPM & mitigation measures as detailed in the BS 5228-1:2009+A1:2014 - Code of practice for noise & vibration control on construction & open sites-Part 1: Noise, BS 5228-2:2009+A1:2014.
o	Details of enclosure of working areas and the location of compounds for the storage of plant and materials;
o	Site security during construction;
o	Construction methods, including basement excavation and construction
o	Site management and access;
o	Vehicle and machinery specifications;
o	Numbers / frequency of vehicles/deliveries;
o	Procedures for on-site contractors to deal with complaints from local residents

The Construction Management Plan shall be implemented on commencement of any works on site and the site shall be managed in accordance with the approved plan for the duration of demolition and construction.

Reason: In the interests of the amenity of adjoining occupiers and to minimise highway and traffic impact during the course of the works, in accordance with policies 1.1 (e) (f) (j) of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy 2012, policy T7 of the London Plan(2021) and policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan the National Planning Policy Framework (2019), Greater London Authority Best Practice Guidance 'The Control of Dust and Emissions from Construction and Demolition (2006), BS 5228-1:2009 - Code of practice for noise & vibration control on construction & open sites-Part 1: Noise.

| Prior to commencement of the development, details for surface water drainage works and a detailed maintenance plan shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the council in accordance with the following criteria:
(i) The drainage system must be designed to control runoff up to a 1 in 100 year storm event.
(ii) The rate at which surface water is discharged from the site may vary with the severity of  the storm event but must not exceed the greenfield runoff rate for a given storm event.
(iii) Excess surface water runoff must be stored on site and released to receiving watercourses at greenfield rates.
(iv) Surface water discharges to watercourses must not have greater velocity than 1 m/s.

Submitted details shall also include a site specific ground investigation with accompanying engineering drawings and borehole scan results; a ground investigation with sketched structural details which specify the depth and arrangement of foundations; an assessment of basement impacts on drainage with flooding from all sources (surface water and ground water impacts); ground water conditions and structural stability where appropriate shall be included to ensure the development does not result in flooding or ground instability.

Reason: To ensure the development does not result in flooding or ground instability and for reasons of sustainable development in accordance with policy SI13 of the London Plan (2021) and policy 1.1 of Ealing's Development Strategy (2026) and policies 5.12 and EA of Ealing's Development Management DPD (2013) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2019) | The redundant crossovers to the site shall be reinstated to pavement prior to occupation of the development. Such re-instatement shall be implemented by the Council at the applicant's expense prior to first occupation of the development hereby approved

Reason: In the interests of highway and pedestrian safety, and in the interests of living conditions of adjoining occupiers and future occupiers of the development hereby permitted in accordance with London Plan policy T2, and Development Strategy policies 1.1(g) and 1.2(f). | The flank wall windows of the development from first floor level upwards shall contain obscure glazing from 1.8m above the internal floor level of the development and shall be retained thereafter

Reason: To protect the living conditions of occupants of nearby properties and future occupiers of the development, in accordance with policies 7A  and 7B of the Ealing Development Management Plan (2013) and policy D6 of the London Plan (2021).
| No part of the flat roofs of the hereby approved development shall be used as or altered to form a balcony, roof terrace/garden or similar amenity area.

Reason: To protect the living conditions of occupants of nearby properties and future occupiers of the development, in accordance with policies 7A  and 7B of the Ealing Development Management Plan (2013) and policy D6 of the London Plan (2021). | Prior to occupation of the development, a discreet timber-screened storage area to accommodate bins for recyclable and non-recyclable waste in accordance with the Council's waste guidelines and BS 5906:2005 shall be provided within the forecourt of the scheme hereby approved. It shall be made available for use at all times and shall be retained thereafter.

Reason: To ensure a satisfactory standard of appearance and setting for the development and to ensure that the proposed development enhances the visual amenity of the locality, in the interests of the amenities of the occupants of the development in accordance with policy 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013) and policy D6 of the London Plan(2021) | Two (2) off-street car parking spaces for use by the occupants of the development shall be provided as shown on the approved plan with defined points of access to the shared forecourt. The parking spaces shall be kept unobstructed for the safe entry and exit of vehicles at all times; and shall be retained thereafter.

Reason: To ensure off-street parking does not prejudice pedestrian or highway safety and to ensure that the development does not result in an increased demand for parking that cannot be safely met within the locality of the site in compliance with London Plan (2021) policy T6. | At least sixteen (16) secure cycle parking spaces shall be provided on site. Such provision shall be brought to use prior to the occupation of the development and retained thereafter.
Reason: To encourage sustainable transport modes in accordance with London Plan (2021) policy T5 and table 10.2
